file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-41-03-04 - LANDING LIGHT CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LANDING LIGHT CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the landing light contactors. B. These procedures are applicable to landing light 1 contactor, nose landing light contactor, and landing light 2 contactor. C. The landing light 1 contactor and nose landing light contactor are installed in the LH Electrical- power control/distribution box and the landing light 2 contactor is installed in the RH Electrical- power control/distribution box. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY LANDING LIGHT CONTACTOR - REMOV- ALL 33-41-03-000-801-A AL LANDING LIGHT CONTACTOR - INSTAL- ALL 33-41-03-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-41-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-41-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. LANDING LIGHT CONTACTOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the landing light contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 223UZ LH cockpit/pax partition 224 224NZ RH cockpit/pax partition D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH cockpit/pax partition I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is deenergized. (2) To get access to the landing light 1 contactor and nose landing light contactor (LH electrical-power control/distribution box), remove the 223UZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (3) To get access to the landing light 2 contactor (RH electrical-power control/distribution box), remove the 224NZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (9). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-41-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the bolt (6) and the washer (5) which attach the fuse (4) to the electrical- power control/distribution box. (3) Remove the nut (7) and the washer (8) which attach the fuse (4) to the landing light contactor (1). (4) Remove the fuse (4). (5) Disconnect the electrical wire (11). For this, remove the nut (10) and washer (12). (6) Remove the four screws (3) and four washers (2) which attach the landing light contactor (1) to the electrical-power control/distribution box. (7) Remove the landing light contactor (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-41-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Landing Light Contactor - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE B C 224 223UZ 224NZ A ZONE 223 DET. A D LANDING LIGHT 1 CONTACTOR (K0233) D NOSE LANDING LIGHT CONTACTOR (K0237) D LANDING LIGHT 2 CONTACTOR (K0234) RH ELECTRICAL-POWER LH ELECTRICAL-POWER DET. B DET. C 1 10. NUT CONTROL/DISTRIBUTION CONTROL/DISTRIBUTION BOX BOX 11. ELECTRICAL WIRE 12. WASHER 1 TORQUE OF 2.6 TO 2.9 N.m(23 TO 26 lbf.in) 2 TORQUE OF 6.8 TO 7.9 N.m(60 TO 70 lbf.in) 1. LANDING LIGHT CONTACTOR 9. ELECTRICAL (K0233 OR K0234 OR K0237) CONNECTOR 2. WASHER (4) 8. WASHER 3. SCREW (4) 4. FUSE 1 5. WASHER 7. NUT DET. D 2 145AMM300144.MCE A 6. BOLT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-41-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-41-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. LANDING LIGHT CONTACTOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the landing light contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 33-41-00-700-801-A/500 LANDING LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 223UZ LH cockpit/pax partition 224 224NZ RH cockpit/pax partition D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To apply the correct torque available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH cockpit/pax partition I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the landing light contactor (1) in the electrical-power control/distribution box. (2) Tighten the four screws (3) and four washers (2) which attach the landing light contactor (1) to the electrical-power control/distribution box. (3) Connect the electrical wire (11) with the washer (12) and nut (10). (4) Put the fuse (4) in its installation position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-41-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) Tighten the washer (8) and the nut (7) which attach the fuse (4) to the landing light contactor (1). (6) Tighten the bolt (6) and the washer (5) which attach the fuse (4) to the electrical-power control/distribution box. (7) Connect the electrical connector (9). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the 223UZ or 224NZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (2) Do the operational test of the landing light ( AMM TASK 33-41-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-41-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
